name: 梁曉帆
objective: This course provides an overview of the basic concepts of decision theory and their applications on the real-world decision problems. Students will learn about the identification and modeling of decision problems, the modeling and estimation of uncertainties, and the modeling and evaluation of preferences.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: Elements of decision problems
Week 3: Structuring decisions
Week 4: Making choices
Week 5: Sensitivity analysis
Week 6: Creativity and decision making
Week 7: Probability basics
Week 8: Subjective probability
Week 9: Mid-term exam
Week 10: Theoretical probability models
Week 11: Using data
Week 12: Monte Carlo simulation/Value of Information
Week 13: Risk attitudes
Week 14: Utility axioms, paradoxes, and implications
Week 15: Conflicting objectives I
Week 16: Conflicting objectives II
Week 17: Wrap-up
Week 18: Final exam
scorePolicy:
Mid-term exam: 40%
Final exam: 30%
Homework and Participation: 30%
materials: Making hard decisions with DeccisionTools (2001) by Clemen and Reilly, Duxbury (雙葉)
